overview:
Tobias Peggs has been involved in the creation and growth of early-stage internet companies since the mid-’90s.

He was most recently CEO of Boulder-based OneRiot. Tobias led OneRiot through its pivot from consumer-facing search engine to socially-targeted mobile advertising platform – ultimately leading to acquisition by Walmart. At Walmart, Tobias was responsible for mobile products in non-US markets - driving the UK from zero to 50% of weekly global mobile revenue inside 12 months.

Prior to OneRiot, Tobias led strategic initiatives at Netdecisions – a UK-based consulting and investment firm. There he incubated and operated several new businesses in the US, UK and India. These spanned e-commerce (Travel), consumer-web (Dating), and enterprise software (Speech Recognition). Before that, he was Managing Editor and Online Editor of i–D Magazine, part of the TimeOut group.

Tobias holds a PhD in Machine Learning from Cardiff University (UK). While studying at Cardiff he produced the UK’s first online student newspaper, and co-founded FineTime – an early online entertainment guide. He also holds a First Class Hons Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering from Loughborough University (UK).

Tobias is a Techstars (Boulder) Mentor, and actively advises several early-stage companies - including Visual Revenue, Local Response, Send Grid, Verbalize.It and Ubooly.
